alert.note: Alert for Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 16 at 9:07PM AKST until January 17 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Blowing and drifting snow with low visibility and wind chills to 55 below. East winds gusting to 30 mph. Visibility one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Western Arctic Coast. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult. Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. Snow drifts will form. Wind chills to 55 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Very cold wind chills will moderate slightly overnight. Although visibility has improved this evening, snow spreading into the area overnight will cause reduced visibility again late tonight into Tuesday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
